messages: 45bf7b53505b0dabeecf80f80c6799b2 (09:38): g33sp0t: the only 3.4.6 (4.x is bad on hardened so it installed 3.4.6-r1)  [6] i686-pc-linux-gnu-3.4.6 * [7] i686-pc-linux-gnu-3.4.6-hardenednopie [8] i686-pc-linux-gnu-3.4.6-hardenednopiessp [9] i686-pc-linux-gnu-3.4.6-hardenednossp [10] i686-pc-linux-gnu-3.4.6-vanilla
45bf7b53505b0dabeecf80f80c6799b2 (09:38): wtf it pasted as like one line even though it said 5 lines?
1f13365bf87be23ac7413ea1c3a6c141 (09:40): so just gcc-config and select hardened for your version of gcc
45bf7b53505b0dabeecf80f80c6799b2 (09:40): it didn't install just 'hardened' for smoe reason
1f13365bf87be23ac7413ea1c3a6c141 (09:40): * gcc-config: Invalid switch!  Run gcc-config without parameters for help.
45bf7b53505b0dabeecf80f80c6799b2 (09:41): i know but i dont have it
1f13365bf87be23ac7413ea1c3a6c141 (09:41): * If you intend to use the gcc from the new profile in an already
1f13365bf87be23ac7413ea1c3a6c141 (09:41): * running shell, please remember to do:

45bf7b53505b0dabeecf80f80c6799b2 (09:41): (chroot) rescuecd / # gcc-config -l [1] i686-pc-linux-gnu-3.3.5-20050130 [2] i686-pc-linux-gnu-3.3.5-20050130-hardenednopie [3] i686-pc-linux-gnu-3.3.5-20050130-hardenednopiessp [4] i686-pc-linux-gnu-3.3.5-20050130-hardenednossp [5] i686-pc-linux-gnu-3.3.5-20050130-vanilla [6] i686-pc-linux-gnu-3.4.6 * [7] i686-pc-linux-gnu-3.4.6-hardenednopie [8] i686-pc-linux-gnu-3.4.6-hardenednopiessp
45bf7b53505b0dabeecf80f80c6799b2 (09:41): switching from unix/dos escape characters is fucking up the lines
1f13365bf87be23ac7413ea1c3a6c141 (09:43): you try recompiling 3.4.6? that's all i can think of, i've always had hardened as an option
45bf7b53505b0dabeecf80f80c6799b2 (09:43): i just finished compiling a second ago
1f13365bf87be23ac7413ea1c3a6c141 (09:43): if you ask in gentoo about it, i know someone will know, "how come i dont have 3.4.6 under gcc-config as an option'
1f13365bf87be23ac7413ea1c3a6c141 (09:44): your toolchain is probroably fucked up as well
45bf7b53505b0dabeecf80f80c6799b2 (09:45): should i let it all upgrade first?
1f13365bf87be23ac7413ea1c3a6c141 (09:45): yeah i would try doing it by the book before i bitched about missing features :P
1f13365bf87be23ac7413ea1c3a6c141 (09:45): i always upgrade gcc with emerge gcc gcc-config glibc
45bf7b53505b0dabeecf80f80c6799b2 (09:45): and it brought in the others
1f13365bf87be23ac7413ea1c3a6c141 (09:46): however i dont have an option for 4.1.1 hardened
1f13365bf87be23ac7413ea1c3a6c141 (09:46): would, just prelinking your library's be just as efficient? :P
1f13365bf87be23ac7413ea1c3a6c141 (09:46): i dont know alot about hardened gcc
1f13365bf87be23ac7413ea1c3a6c141 (09:47): without knowing why? not a good start :P
45bf7b53505b0dabeecf80f80c6799b2 (09:47): they alls aid i should use hardneed
45bf7b53505b0dabeecf80f80c6799b2 (09:47): especially since i might host ircd's and irc is a target for attack usually
1f13365bf87be23ac7413ea1c3a6c141 (09:48): i believe the idea behind hardened is so that's it's harder to manipulate binry's on the box
45bf7b53505b0dabeecf80f80c6799b2 (09:48): but still a good idea to secure a dedi
1f13365bf87be23ac7413ea1c3a6c141 (09:48): although kde users get a speedup from prelinking anyway
1f13365bf87be23ac7413ea1c3a6c141 (09:49): ok well,i'mma part flud :P i hate it here, it's like bieng in a sewer :P sorry/
